Description: Painted wooden shabti of Pashedu with black tripartite wig ending in yellow and red stripes, red bordered yellow collar with black divisions within each row, arms crossed in relief holding red-bordered yellow painted hoes and, over each shoulder, red criss-crossed yellow basket with red thongs on lower side hanging loose; white painted body; down lower front seven horizontal lines of black (?) painted incised hieroglyphs giving chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead, identifying the deceased as servant in the Place of Truth.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
